page.title: 15CHARLTON-ON-OTMOOR CHURCH
page.content: The name of our Church is St.Mary's.In the porch is a small stained glass window of St.George slaying the Dragon. The Church is built in the shape of a cross.It has recently had a new pinnacle on the Church Tower because lighting struck the old one.The church is about 700yrs old.In the churchyard are the remains of a 13th century cross.The proudest possession of the church is the late 15th century screen.On May the 1st each year a great cross of flowers and evergreens is placed on top of the screen.The screen is hand painted.A long May Garland is hung on the screen on May Day.This is made of hoops and rope covered with evergreens and flowers.Some of the pillars have the remains of paintings on them.There is an old brass near the Alter.
